dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6549 IH: Fairness in Airspace Includes Residents Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Eshoo (for herself, Mr. Cárdenas, Mr. Mullin, Mr. Panetta, and Mr. Sherman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to direct the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to adjust certain requirements with respect to sovereignty and use of airspace, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fairness in Airspace Includes Residents Act or the F-AIR Act.

subsection.text: Section 40103(b)(1) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall develop plans and policy for the use of the navigable airspace and assign by regulation or order the use of the airspace necessary to ensure—

clause.text: as a primary priority, the safety of aircraft; and

subclause.text: the efficient use of airspace; and
the minimization of the impact of aviation noise, and other health impacts, on residents and communities, and other impacts of the use of airspace on the environment.

subparagraph.text: The Administrator may modify or revoke an assignment when required in the public interest.

subsection.text: Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall—

paragraph.text: review the regulations, policies, procedures, and processes of the Administration and modify them as necessary to reflect the priorities in clauses (i) and (ii) of section 40103(b)(1)(A) of title 49, United States Code, as added by subsection (a); and
update the mission statement of the Administration to reflect such priorities.
